meanings.definition: More severe or strict in manner or treatment.
meanings.sent1: The teacher became even harsher when the students continued to misbehave.
meanings.sent2: The punishment for breaking the rule was getting even harsher.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a harsher look when it saw the dog playing with its toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm grew harsher, pounding the roof with relentless force.
meanings.sent5: The harsher tone in his voice made it clear that he was not pleased.

meanings.definition: Unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses.
meanings.sent1: The rough sandpaper felt even harsher against his skin.
meanings.sent2: The loud music became harsher as the volume increased.
meanings.sent3: The harsher taste of the medicine made the child scrunch up his face.
meanings.sent4: The harsher wind whipped through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle loudly.
meanings.sent5: The harsher lighting in the room made it difficult to see clearly.

meanings.sent1: The basement felt even harsher with its cold and damp air.
meanings.sent2: The harsher weather brought a chill that seeped into their bones.
meanings.sent3: The harsher smell of mildew in the old house made her wrinkle her nose.
meanings.sent4: The harsher fog rolled in, enveloping everything in a damp mist.
meanings.sent5: The harsher conditions outside made staying indoors a more appealing option.
